mil.nga.giat.geowave.datastore.accumulo

Class BasicAccumuloOperations

  • java.lang.Object
    • mil.nga.giat.geowave.datastore.accumulo.BasicAccumuloOperations
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AccumuloOperations

    public class BasicAccumuloOperations
extends Object
implements AccumuloOperations
    This class holds all parameters necessary for establishing Accumulo connections and provides basic factory methods for creating a batch scanner and a batch writer

    • Field Detail

      • connector

        protected org.apache.accumulo.core.client.Connector connector

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicAccumuloOperations

        public BasicAccumuloOperations(String zookeeperUrl,
                       String instanceName,
                       String userName,
                       String password,
                       String tableNamespace)
                        throws org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloException,
                               org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloSecurityException
        This is will create an Accumulo connector based on passed in connection information and credentials for convenience convenience. It will also use reasonable defaults for unspecified parameters.
        Parameters:
        zookeeperUrl - The comma-delimited URLs for all zookeeper servers, this will be directly used to instantiate a ZookeeperInstance
        instanceName - The zookeeper instance name, this will be directly used to instantiate a ZookeeperInstance
        userName - The username for an account to establish an Accumulo connector
        password - The password for the account to establish an Accumulo connector
        tableNamespace - An optional string that is prefixed to any of the table names
        Throws:
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloException - Thrown if a generic exception occurs when establishing a connector
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloSecurityException - the credentials passed in are invalid

      • BasicAccumuloOperations

        public BasicAccumuloOperations(org.apache.accumulo.core.client.Connector connector)
        This constructor uses reasonable defaults and only requires an Accumulo connector
        Parameters:
        connector - The connector to use for all operations

      • BasicAccumuloOperations

        public BasicAccumuloOperations(org.apache.accumulo.core.client.Connector connector,
                       String tableNamespace)
        This constructor uses reasonable defaults and requires an Accumulo connector and table namespace
        Parameters:
        connector - The connector to use for all operations
        tableNamespace - An optional string that is prefixed to any of the table names

      • BasicAccumuloOperations

        public BasicAccumuloOperations(int numThreads,
                       long timeoutMillis,
                       long byteBufferSize,
                       String authorization,
                       String tableNamespace,
                       org.apache.accumulo.core.client.Connector connector)
        This is the full constructor for the operation factory and should be used if any of the defaults are insufficient.
        Parameters:
        numThreads - The number of threads to use for a batch scanner and batch writer
        timeoutMillis - The time out in milliseconds to use for a batch writer
        byteBufferSize - The buffer size in bytes to use for a batch writer
        authorization - The authorization to use for a batch scanner
        tableNamespace - An optional string that is prefixed to any of the table names
        connector - The connector to use for all operations

      • createWriter

        public Writer createWriter(String tableName)
                    throws org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException
        Description copied from interface: AccumuloOperations
        Creates a new writer that can be used by an index. The basic implementation uses a BatchWriter but other implementations can be replaced such as a context-based writer for bulk ingest within a map-reduce job. A table is created by default if it does not exist with no custom iterators.
        Specified by:
        createWriter in interface AccumuloOperations
        Parameters:
        tableName - The basic name of the table. Note that that basic implementation of the factory will allow for a table namespace to prefix this name
        Returns:
        The appropriate writer
        Throws:
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException - The table does not exist in this Accumulo instance

      • createWriter

        public Writer createWriter(String tableName,
                  boolean createTable)
                    throws org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException
        Description copied from interface: AccumuloOperations
        Creates a new writer that can be used by an index. The basic implementation uses a BatchWriter but other implementations can be replaced such as a context-based writer for bulk ingest within a map-reduce job. This will use the createTable flag to determine if the table should be created if it does not exist.
        Specified by:
        createWriter in interface AccumuloOperations
        Parameters:
        tableName - The basic name of the table. Note that that basic implementation of the factory will allow for a table namespace to prefix this name
        createTable - If true and the table does not exist, it will be created. If false and the table does not exist, a TableNotFoundException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        The appropriate writer
        Throws:
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException - The table does not exist in this Accumulo instance

      • deleteTable

        public boolean deleteTable(String tableName)
        Description copied from interface: AccumuloOperations
        Drops the table with the given name (the basic implementation will use a table namespace prefix if given). Returns whether the table was found and the operation completed successfully.
        Specified by:
        deleteTable in interface AccumuloOperations
        Parameters:
        tableName - The basic name of the table. Note that that basic implementation of the factory will allow for a table namespace to prefix this name
        Returns:
        Returns true if the table was found and dropped, false if it was not found or not dropped successfully

        public void deleteAll()
               throws org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloSecurityException,
                      org.apache.accumulo.core.client.AccumuloException,
                      org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException
        Description copied from interface: AccumuloOperations
        Drops all tables in the instance namespace. If no tables are found in the namespace no operation occurs.
        Specified by:
        deleteAll in interface AccumuloOperations

      • delete

        public boolean delete(String tableName,
             ByteArrayId rowId,
             String columnFamily,
             String columnQualifier)
        Description copied from interface: AccumuloOperations
        Drops the specified row from the specified table. Returns whether the operation completed successfully.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface AccumuloOperations
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table to delete from, this must be provided
        rowId - the row ID to delete, this must be provided
        columnFamily - the column family of the row to delete, this can be null to delete the whole row
        columnQualifier - the column qualifier for a given column family to delete, this can be null to delete the whole column family
        Returns:
        Returns true if the row deletion didn't encounter any errors, false if nothing was found or the row was not dropped successfully

        columnFamily - the column family of the row to delete, this can be null to delete the whole row
        additionalAuthorizations - checks authorizations
        Returns:

      • attachIterators

        public boolean attachIterators(String tableName,
                      boolean createTable,
                      IteratorConfig[] iterators)
                        throws org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException
        Description copied from interface: AccumuloOperations
        Attaches the iterators to the specified table. This will check if the scope is the same and if the options are the same. If the options are different, it will use the implementation of IteratorConfig.mergeOptions() to perform the merge. This will use the createTable flag to determine if the table should be created if it does not exist.
        Specified by:
        attachIterators in interface AccumuloOperations
        Parameters:
        tableName - The basic name of the table. Note that that basic implementation of the factory will allow for a table namespace to prefix this name
        createTable - If true and the table does not exist, it will be created. If false and the table does not exist, a TableNotFoundException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        A flag indicating whether the iterator was successfully attached.
        Throws:
        org.apache.accumulo.core.client.TableNotFoundException - The table does not exist in this Accumulo instance
